channel.title: Epicurus - What would you like to see?
channel.description:
After much thinking, JaydenD12 and I have decided to relaunch Epicurus with the help off Ruby. We'd like to ask the community what you'd like to see, so please reply here with your answers.
We're working off Jayden's release, Epicurus' released source and client. If you have any other questions or queries please post below.
One more major thing I'd like to note, we're only running one world, with both economy and pking.
I'd just like to note, that considering Jayden's name and my name are the same, I decided to use my middle name on the forums/server which is Kieran.
Thanks, Epicurus Team.

item.title: Epicurus - What would you like to see?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Section rules:[quote=“Lin, post:1, topic:450235”]Those are just a few very broad examples. Post what you would like to, but please refrain from posting about specific servers. That counts as advertising and you should post advertisements Here.[/quote]

[quote=“sinisoul, post:21, topic:537067”]Blatant advertising/Spam. This isn’t your section to ask questions that you could be asking on your development or advertisement thread.

It’s like this thread: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,655503.0.html

No one particularly cares.[/quote]Went ahead and deleted that one too.

Read full topic

item.source: Epicurus - What would you like to see?

item.title: Epicurus - What would you like to see?
item.dc:creator: @Jayden2 Jayden.
item.description:
@Jayden2 wrote:

[quote=“JavaTC, post:15, topic:537067”]Think I remember playing this server.

Only one thing, very light rules.

I’m so sick of the amount of censorship servers try to enforce. Not in the form of fudgeshitdickassrunt, but rather a player can be an asshole to someone (kill them in the wild endlessly while he was only trying to watch), the guy criticizes him for it, and he ends up getting muted because the asshole ran to the forums and said “omg so disrespecttfuall if u dnt want to dye then dnt go in wild noob”

Yes, it’s happened to me
Yes, more than once

Let players work out their issues between themselves rather than waiting until one pulls some stupid ad hominem attack on race or some shit so you mute them. If they want to make themselves look stupid, let them, it say a lot more about them than it does about the actual server.[/quote]

We will take this into consideration.

HcoJustin:

Make it less exploitable than the last version rofl

Will do.

Read full topic
item.source: Epicurus - What would you like to see?

item.title: Epicurus - What would you like to see?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Think I remember playing this server.

Only one thing, very light rules.

I’m so sick of the amount of censorship servers try to enforce. Not in the form of fuckshitdickasscunt, but rather a player can be an asshole to someone (kill them in the wild endlessly while he was only trying to watch), the guy criticizes him for it, and he ends up getting muted because the asshole ran to the forums and said “omg so disrespecttfuall if u dnt want to dye then dnt go in wild noob”

Yes, it’s happened to me
Yes, more than once

Let players work out their issues between themselves rather than waiting until one pulls some stupid ad hominem attack on race or some shit so you mute them. If they want to make themselves look stupid, let them, it say a lot more about them than it does about the actual server.

Read full topic

item.title: Epicurus - What would you like to see?
item.dc:creator: @Jayden2 Jayden.
item.description:
@Jayden2 wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:11, topic:537067”]I never played Epicurus, so ignore the suggestions that are already added:
-Wilderness target system (Killing target results in 2x more pkp)
-Clan Wars (Great Minigame to have), also should have as many games as you can do
-Custom Quests with Rewards
-Cool Donator Zones that actually make it worth donating
-Make sure you have a general store to sell drops from npcs to for easy money making
-Summoning with special attacks
-Dwarf Cannon
-Construction (would be sick af)[/quote]

I’ll be sure to get all off that done, however it will take some time.

Read full topic
item.source: Epicurus - What would you like to see?

item.title: Epicurus - What would you like to see?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

I’m fine with such an idea seeing as you want to give some form or another of an aesthetic compensation for donating. But why offer items such as what you mentioned? To me, that says that if you have the money, why participate in uncommon game events when I can just buy those items? Perhaps offer robes, unique (customized) fun items that have options to “whack” others. That’s just my two cents, though.

Read full topic
item.source: Epicurus - What would you like to see?

item.title: Epicurus - What would you like to see?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I’ll let the server sided developers reply to your post, marc.

Just going to give everyone an overview of the donation system that will be employed. No item that is bought from the donation store can be sold or give in-game boosts. All items are merely for aesthetics. My idea to do this was to have 2 different models for each the donation item and the in-game item. For example: we hit 300 players online, we decide to do a small drop party to get some of the rare items into the economy that can’t be gotten from drops such as party hats. These can be traded and sold. However, the party hat that you donate for cannot be traded or sold because of the different model, it looks the exact same but because of the different ID’s one can be exempt from trades. This way donating does not effect the economy in the slightest, it instead actually boosts the staffs input into doing some form of events every now and again.

Once again: The items that can be donated for will only be aesthetic. No torva, weapons etc. Party hats, some pieces of clothing, santa hats, halloween masks and that general type of thing.

Anyone have any objections to that?

Read full topic
item.source: Epicurus - What would you like to see?

item.title: Epicurus - What would you like to see?
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

I never played Epicurus, so ignore the suggestions that are already added:
-Wilderness target system (Killing target results in 2x more pkp)
-Clan Wars (Great Minigame to have), also should have as many games as you can do
-Custom Quests with Rewards
-Cool Donator Zones that actually make it worth donating
-Make sure you have a general store to sell drops from npcs to for easy money making
-Summoning with special attacks
-Dwarf Cannon
-Construction (would be sick af)

Read full topic

@Jayden2 wrote:

After much thinking, JaydenD12 and I have decided to relaunch Epicurus with the help off Ruby. We’d like to ask the community what you’d like to see, so please reply here with your answers.

We’re working off Jayden’s release, Epicurus’ released source and client. If you have any other questions or queries please post below.

One more major thing I’d like to note, we’re only running one world, with both economy and pking.

I’d just like to note, that considering Jayden’s name and my name are the same, I decided to use my middle name on the forums/server which is Kieran.
